result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier T Douglas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the unpaid restitution amounts.

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 5% restitution surcharge.
The Court orders entry of a civil judgments for any unpaid court financial obligations.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Douglas to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 3:28pm. 
Defendant Xavier T Douglas in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Douglas to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Douglas to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, concurrent to count #1

On Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. Douglas to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, concurrent to counts #1 & #2

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:12 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Xavier T Douglas in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Ashley Burke--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by ADA Hall
--cross exam by Atty Zarwell

Xavier Douglas--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Zarwell
--cross exam by ADA Hall
Evidence Closed

Court presents basis and orders restitution in the amount of $544.92 payable to Ashley & Eric Burke - to be paid prior to costs and DNA Surcharge
Recess: 3:46 pm

NEXT: Amend JOC
Restitution hearing on August 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Criminal case settlement
Scheduling notice

Case called at 11:19 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Xavier T Douglas in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; DA Happ submits victim impact statement & restitution request. Informs the Court that victim is requesting $1500, but need verification for those expenses. Believe there is joint recommendation for probation and request to adjourn restitution for 45 days, hopeful agreement can be reached prior to that date
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

On Counts #1, #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $729 ($243 each count)
--To pay $600 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay restitution of $1500 or amount as later determined
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee 
--No contact with Rebecca Kemmel
--No presence at W2340 Hansen Rd. Town of Sullivan

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court presents basis and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation
Recess: 11:32 am 

NEXT: Schedule Restitution Hearing 8/1/14 at 3:00 pm - Send notices
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2014 at 11:15 am.
for continuance granted
Proposed STAO for continuance
Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling notice
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 10:24am. 
Defendant Xavier T Douglas in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Hall informs the Court that she has just realized that the State has failed to make any contact with a victim in this case; because there is resitution involved, the State is not prepared to proceed to the sentencing portion of the hearing today. 

On Motion of the State the Court amends Count #1 to Class A Misdemeanor Criminal Trespass to a Dwelling as a Party to the Crime contrary to Statutes 943.14 & 939.05;  and further, the Court adds a charge of Count #3: Class A Misdemeanor Criminal Damage to Property as a Party to the Crime contrary to Statutes 943.01(1) & 939.05

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; elements recited;  pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts pleas, finds Mr. Douglas guilty of Counts #1, #2 and #3, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
recess 10:40am. 

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing on 5/16/14 at 11:00am.
Status conference on April 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
